docs.summary: API to manage events and categories

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

docs.summary: Adds an input control to the draft form.

examples.title: Add phone
Add full address
Add single line address
Add date
Add +1 additional guest with mandatory guest name
Add multiple additional guests
Add dropdown
Add checkbox
Add comment text area
body:
curl -X POST 'https://www.wixapis.com/events/v1/events/ad18d12e-a6a9-4c17-abfa-6ff119479be2/form/control' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: <AUTH TOKEN>' \
-d @- << EOF
{
  "text": {
    "label": "Comment",
    "mandatory": true,
    "maxLength": 1000,
    "multiLine": true,
    "comment": true
  }
}
EOF

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: ID of category to which events should be assigned.

docs.summary: Assigns events to a single category.

body:
curl -X POST 'https://www.wixapis.com/events/v1/categories/e9779de3-a085-4255-b3a6-9559990d4436/events' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: <AUTH TOKEN>' \
-d @- << EOF
{
  "categoryId": "e9779de3-a085-4255-b3a6-9559990d4436",
  "eventId": [
    "539a564e-48d2-4eac-8e14-d7a91be6b1c2",
    "abd39eb7-844c-4321-9ea2-0d43040be05e"
  ]
}
EOF

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: A list of category ids to which events should be assigned.

docs.summary: Assigns events to multiple categories.

body:
curl -X POST 'https://www.wixapis.com/events/v1/bulk/categories/events' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: <AUTH TOKEN>' \
-d @- << EOF
{
  "categoryId": [
    "e9779de3-a085-4255-b3a6-9559990d4436",
    "027ac25d-cc64-4eb1-8666-4ea53cf7f134"
   ],
  "eventId": [
    "539a564e-48d2-4eac-8e14-d7a91be6b1c2"
  ]
}
EOF

docs.summary: Assigns filtered events to multiple categories.
Assigns filtered events to multiple categories.

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

docs.summary:
Cancels events by filter.
If event cancellation notifications are enabled, canceling an event automatically sends cancellation emails and/or push notifications to registered guests.

> **Note:**
> This endpoint is relevant only for [Headless](https://dev.wix.com/docs/go-headless/getting-started/about-headless/about-wix-headless) projects.

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

docs.summary:
Cancels events by filter.
If event cancellation notifications are enabled, canceling an event automatically sends cancellation emails and/or push notifications to registered guests.

> **Note:**
> This endpoint is relevant only for [Headless](https://dev.wix.com/docs/go-headless/getting-started/about-headless/about-wix-headless) projects.
Creates new categories.

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

docs.summary:
Deletes events by filter.
Deleted events are not returned via API. The only way to retrieve them is via GDPR access request.

> **Note:**
> This endpoint is relevant only for [Headless](https://dev.wix.com/docs/go-headless/getting-started/about-headless/about-wix-headless) projects.

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

docs.summary:
Deletes events by filter.
Deleted events are not returned via API. The only way to retrieve them is via GDPR access request.

> **Note:**
> This endpoint is relevant only for [Headless](https://dev.wix.com/docs/go-headless/getting-started/about-headless/about-wix-headless) projects.
Unassigns events from multiple categories.
Unassigns filtered events from multiple categories.
Unassigns filtered events from multiple categories.

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

docs.summary:
Cancels an event and closes registration.
 If event cancellation notifications are enabled, canceling an event automatically sends cancellation emails and/or push notifications to registered guests.

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

params.name: draft
params.doc:
If true, event will be copied as draft.
 Otherwise copied event will be published, unless it is draft.

docs.summary:
Copies an event, including its registration form, notifications and tickets configuration - scheduled two weeks from the original event.
 Multilingual translations are also copied to the new event.

 When an event with same title already exists, appends (1), (2), ... to it. For example, copying an event titled "My Event" creates "My Event (1)".
 Very long event titles are cropped: "Daily stand-up ev... (2)".

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

params.name: fields
params.doc:
Set of field paths to update.
 <!--ONLY:REST-->
 Fields will be auto-populated from the `event` entity unless added to the request explicitly.
 <!--END:ONLY:REST-->
 Behavior follows [google.protobuf.FieldMask](https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/reference/google.protobuf#google.protobuf.FieldMask) semantics.

params.name: draft
params.doc:
If true, event will be copied as draft.
 Otherwise copied event will be published, unless it is draft.

docs.summary:
Copies an event, including its registration form, notifications and tickets configuration - scheduled two weeks from the original event.
 Multilingual translations are also copied to the new event.
 Supports partial update of the original event fields. See [Partial Updates](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/partial-updates) for more information.

 When an event with same title already exists, appends (1), (2), ... to it. For example, copying an event titled "My Event" creates "My Event (1)".
 Very long event titles are cropped: "Daily stand-up ev... (2)".
Creates a new category.

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

params.name: language
params.doc:
Content language code in ISO 639-1 format.
 Used for translating ticket PDF labels, registration form, automatic emails, etc.
 Supported languages: ar, bg, cs, da, de, el, en, es, fi, fr, he, hi, hu, id, it, ja, ko, ms, nl, no, pl, pt, ro, ru, sv, th, tl, tr, uk, zh.
 Defaults to en.

params.name: draft
params.doc: Whether event should be created as draft. Draft events are hidden from site visitors.

docs.summary:
Creates a new event, with a default registration form in the given language.
 Default registration form includes first name, last name, and email inputs.
 To learn more about registration form and customize it, see [Registration Form](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/registration-form/about-the-registration-form-api).
 The event is automatically configured to send daily summary reports of new registrations to site business email.
 RegistrationConfig.initialType is required - allowed value when creating is RSVP or TICKETS.

examples.title: Create RSVP event
Create TBD ticketed event
Create draft event

params.name: fieldset
params.doc:
Controls which event properties are returned. See [Fieldset](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/fieldset#wix-events_wix-events_fieldset_event-fieldset).
 Some fields require additional computation that affects latency.
 Use minimum set of required fieldset for best performance.

docs.summary:
Finds an event by ID or URL slug. In contrast to Get Event endpoint which returns not found error,
Find Event returns empty response when an event is not found.

> **Note:**
> This endpoint is relevant only for [Headless](https://dev.wix.com/docs/go-headless/getting-started/about-headless/about-wix-headless) projects.

Retrieves a list of up to 100 events, given the provided [paging](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/pagination) and category_id.
 Events are sorted by the sort index defined by CategoryManagement.
Lists visible event categories.

docs.summary:
Publishes draft event so that it becomes available to site visitors.
If recurring events are set, category with state RECURRING_EVENT will be created.
All recurring events will be assigned to this category.

> **Note:**
> This endpoint is relevant only for [Headless](https://dev.wix.com/docs/go-headless/getting-started/about-headless/about-wix-headless) projects.

params.name: fieldset
params.doc:
Predefined sets of fields to return.
- `COUNTS`: Returns `assignedEventsCount`.

docs.summary:
- `filter` - supported for `name`, `id` and `states` fields.
   - `sort` - supported for `created` and `name` fields.
   - `paging` - supported, see [paging](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/pagination).
   - `fields` - not supported.
   - `fieldsets` - not supported.
   - `cursorPaging` - not supported, use offset pagination instead.

params.doc:
Whether draft events should be returned in the response.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of up to 1,000 events, given the provided paging, filtering and sorting.

 ** Important **:
   - All results are for one specific business, resolved from the request context.

 Query object support:
   - `filter` - supported, see [filtering and sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/filter-and-sort#wix-events_wix-events_filter-and-sort_list-query-events).
   - `sort` - supported, see [filtering and sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/filter-and-sort#wix-events_wix-events_filter-and-sort_list-query-events).
   - `paging` - supported, see [paging](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/pagination).
   - `fields` - not supported.
   - `fieldsets` - not supported, use request-level `fieldset` instead.
   - `cursorPaging` - not supported, use offset pagination instead.

 Defaults:
   - When filter is not specified, returns all events that caller is authorized to read.
   - When sorting is not specified, defaults to `created` in `DESC` order.
Change the order of category events.
Unassigns events from a single category.
Updates an existing category.

messages.displayName: Form Input Control Deleted Action Event Object

members.name: bodyAsJson
members.doc: Event body as a stringified JSON

members.name: currency
members.doc: ISO 4217 format of the currency i.e. `USD`.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (e.g., 3.99). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

docs.summary: Site URL components

members.name: base
members.doc:
Base URL. For premium sites, this will be the domain.
 For free sites, this would be site URL (e.g `mysite.wixsite.com/mysite`)

members.name: path
members.doc: The path to that page - e.g `/my-events/weekly-meetup-2`

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Facet counts aggregated per value

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type integer

members.name: counts
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Facet counts aggregated per value

docs.summary:
A coarse-grained representation of time duration divided into whole constituting components of days, hours, and minutes.
 For example, 25.5 hours duration is represented as `{ days: 1, hours: 1, minutes: 30 }`.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether the schedule is enabled for the event.

members.name: assignedEventsCount
members.doc: Assigned events count. Deleted events are excluded.

members.name: counts
members.doc: Assigned and assigned draft event counts.

members.name: states
members.doc:
Category state. Default - MANUAL.
 WIX_EVENTS.MANAGE_AUTO_CATEGORIES permission is required to use other states.
 Field will be ignored on update requests.

members.name: assignedEventsCount
members.doc: Assigned events count. Deleted events are excluded.

docs.summary:
The form defines which elements are rendered in the Wix UI during the registration process (RSVP or checkout).
 It also contains customizable messages and labels.


 A form is an ordered list of controls (blocks), which accept guest information into a field input.

 Each control contains one or more nested inputs. For example, `Name` control has two inputs:
 - First Name
 - Last Name

 By default, name and email controls are always required and are pinned to the top of the form.

members.name: controls
members.doc: Nested fields as an ordered list.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Additional labels for multi-valued fields such as address.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

docs.summary: An input of one or multiple text values

members.name: additionalLabels
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Additional labels for multi-valued fields such as address.

members.name: options
members.doc: Predefined choice options for fields, such as dropdown.

members.name: maxLength
members.doc: Maximum number of accepted characters (relevant for text fields).

members.name: type
members.doc:
Type which determines field format.
 Used to validate submitted response.

members.name: maxSize
members.doc:
A maximum accepted values for array input.
 Only applicable for inputs of valueType: TEXT_ARRAY.

members.name: defaultOptionSelection
members.doc:
Preselected option.
 Currently only applicable for dropdown.

members.name: labels
members.doc: Additional labels for multi-valued fields such as address.

members.name: optionIndex
members.doc: 0-based index from predefined `input.options` which is selected initially.

members.name: placeholderText
members.doc:
Placeholder hint describing expected choices (such as "Please select").
 Considered an empty choice.

docs.summary:
A block of nested fields.
 Used to aggregate similar inputs like First Name and Last Name.

members.name: system
members.doc: Whether control is mandatory (such as name & email). When true, only label can be changed.

members.name: orderIndex
members.doc: Field controls are sorted by this value in ascending order.

docs.summary:
Defines form messages shown in UI before, during, and after registration flow.
 It enables configuration of form titles, response labels, "thank you" messages, and call-to-action texts.

members.name: registrationClosed
members.doc: Messages shown when event registration is closed.

members.name: ticketsUnavailable
members.doc: Messages shown when event tickets are unavailable.

docs.summary: Confirmation messages shown after registration.
Set of messages shown during registration when RSVP response is positive.

members.name: title
members.doc: Main form title for positive response.

docs.summary: Confirmation messages shown after registration.
A set of messages shown during registration with negative response

members.name: title
members.doc: Main form title for negative response.

members.name: waitlistMessages
members.doc: Messages shown for RSVP = `WAITING` (when event is full and waitlist is available).

docs.summary: Confirmation messages shown after checkout.

members.name: message
members.doc: Message shown when event registration is closed.

members.name: message
members.doc: Message shown when event tickets are unavailable.

members.name: props
members.doc:
A `{'key':'value'}` pair object where each SEO tag property (`'name'`, `'content'`, `'rel'`, `'href'`) contains a value.
 For example: `{'name': 'description', 'content': 'the description itself'}`.

members.name: meta
members.doc: SEO tag meta data. For example, `{height: 300, width: 240}`.

members.name: children
members.doc: SEO tag inner content. For example, `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc:
Whether the Auto Redirect feature, which creates `301 redirects` on a slug change, is enabled. 


 Default: `false` (Auto Redirect is enabled.)

members.name: keywords
members.doc: User-selected keyword terms for a specific page.

members.name: isMain
members.doc: Whether the keyword is the main focus keyword.

docs.summary:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
 The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
 This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: subdivision (usually state or region) code according to ISO 3166-2

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, Floor

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the human-readable address of this location

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text for human-to-human textual orientation aid purposes

members.name: subdivisions
members.doc: multi-level subdivisions from top to bottom

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: a break down of the street to number and street name

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line (usually street and number) as free text

members.name: about
members.doc: Rich-text content displayed in Wix UI - "About Event" section (HTML).

members.name: slug
members.doc: Event slug URL (generated from event title).

members.name: language
members.doc: ISO 639-1 language code of the event (used in content translations).

members.name: dashboard
members.doc: Event dashboard summary of RSVP / ticket sales.

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: Instance ID of the site where event is hosted.

members.name: feed
members.doc: Event discussion feed. For internal use.

members.name: categories
members.doc: Categories this event is assigned to.

members.name: fullAddress
members.doc:
Full address derived from formatted single line `address`.
 When `full_address` is used to create or update the event, deprecated `address` and `coordinates` are ignored.
 If provided `full_address` has empty `formatted_address` or `coordinates`, it will be auto-completed using Atlas service.

 Migration notes:
 - `full_address.formatted_address` is equivalent to `address`.
 - `full_address.geocode` is equivalent to `coordinates`.

members.name: tbd
members.doc:
Defines event location as TBD (To Be Determined).
 When event location is not yet defined, `name` is displayed instead of location address.
 `coordinates`, `address`, `type` and `full_address` are not required when location is TBD.

members.name: scheduleTbd
members.doc:
Defines event as TBD (To Be Determined) schedule.
 When event time is not yet defined, TBD message is displayed instead of event start and end times.
 `startDate`, `endDate` and `timeZoneId` are not required when schedule is TBD.

members.name: timeZoneId
members.doc: Event time zone ID in TZ database format, e.g., `EST`, `America/Los_Angeles`.

members.name: endDateHidden
members.doc: Whether end date is hidden in the formatted schedule.

members.name: showTimeZone
members.doc: Whether time zone is displayed in formatted schedule.

members.name: timeZoneId
members.doc: Event time zone ID in TZ database format, e.g., `EST`, `America/Los_Angeles`.

members.name: showTimeZone
members.doc: Whether time zone is displayed in formatted schedule.

members.name: startDateFormatted
members.doc: Formatted start date of the event (empty for TBD schedules).

members.name: startTimeFormatted
members.doc: Formatted start time of the event (empty for TBD schedules).

members.name: endDateFormatted
members.doc: Formatted end date of the event (empty for TBD schedules or when end date is hidden).

members.name: endTimeFormatted
members.doc: Formatted end time of the event (empty for TBD schedules or when end date is hidden).

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Total guest limit available to register to the event.
 Additional guests per RSVP are counted towards total guests.

members.name: waitlist
members.doc: Whether a waitlist is opened when total guest limit is reached, allowing guests to create RSVP with WAITING RSVP status.

members.name: lowestTicketPriceFormatted
members.doc: Formatted price of lowest priced ticket.

members.name: highestTicketPriceFormatted
members.doc: Formatted price of highest priced ticket.

members.name: soldOut
members.doc: Whether all tickets are sold for this event.

members.name: appliesToDonations
members.doc: Applies taxes for donations, default true.

members.name: guestAssignedTickets
members.doc: Whether the form must be filled out separately for each ticket.

members.name: ticketLimitPerOrder
members.doc: Limit of tickets that can be purchased per order, default 20.

members.name: reservationDurationInMinutes
members.doc: Duration for which the tickets being bought are reserved.

members.name: restrictedTo
members.doc: Types of users allowed to register.

members.name: initialType
members.doc: Initial event type which was set when creating an event.

members.name: externalRegistrationUrl
members.doc: External event registration URL (for external events only).

members.name: restrictedTo
members.doc: Types of users allowed to register.

members.name: initialType
members.doc:
Initial event type. Only RSVP and TICKETS are allowed when creating an event.
 Updating this field is not allowed.

members.name: revenue
members.doc:
Total revenue, excluding fees.
 (taxes and payment provider fees are not deducted.)

members.name: currencyLocked
members.doc: Whether currency is locked and cannot be changed (generally occurs after the first order in the specified currency has been created).

members.name: ticketingSummary
members.doc:
Summary of revenue and tickets sold.
 (Archived orders are not included).

members.name: publicGuestList
members.doc: Whether members can see other members attending the event (defaults to true).

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether online conferencing is enabled (not supported for TBD schedules).
 When enabled, links to join conferencing are generated and provided to guests.

members.name: hostLink
members.doc: Link for event host to start the online conference session.

members.name: guestLink
members.doc: Link for guests to join the online conference session.

members.name: password
members.doc: The password required to join online conferencing session (when relevant).

members.name: sessionCreated
members.doc: Indicates that session was created successfully on providers side.

members.name: hideEventDetailsButton
members.doc: Whether event details button is hidden. Only available for events with no registration.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.name: totalFailures
members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.name: id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load per page.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]
 See [supported fields](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/filter-and-sort#wix-events_wix-events_filter-and-sort_list-query-events).

members.name: paging
members.doc:
Pointer to page of results using offset.
 See [Pagination](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/pagination).

members.name: userId
members.doc: User who is related to event

members.name: categorised
members.doc:
If true - only categorised events will be returned.
 If false - only not categorised events will be returned.

members.name: states
members.doc: Category states filter. Default - any state.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip. See [Pagination](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/pagination).

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load per page. See [Pagination](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/pagination).

members.name: fieldset
members.doc:
Controls which event properties are returned. See [Fieldset](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/fieldset#wix-events_wix-events_fieldset_event-fieldset).
 Some fields require additional computation that affects latency of the service.
 Use minimum set of required fieldset for best performance.

members.name: facet
members.doc:
Filter facets to include in the response.
 See [supported facets](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/filter-and-sort#wix-events_wix-events_filter-and-sort_list-query-events).

members.name: userId
members.doc: User ID filter, by default any

members.name: includeDrafts
members.doc:
Whether draft events should be returned in the response.
 Requires WIX_EVENTS.MANAGE_EVENTS permission.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Filter facets.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of events that match the given filters.

members.name: facets
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Filter facets.

members.name: userFilter
members.doc:
Wix user filter, by default any.
 Allows to filter events by user relation to the event among all wix sites.

members.name: facet
members.doc:
Filter facets to include in the response.
 See [supported facets](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/filter-and-sort#wix-events_wix-events_filter-and-sort_list-query-events).

 Some fields require additional computation that affects latency.

members.name: location
members.doc:
Event location.
 Address is required for non TBD event.
 Location name is required for TBD event.

members.name: mainImage
members.doc:
Main event image. Printed in ticket PDF.
 Currently, only images previously saved in Wix Media are supported.

members.name: rsvpCollectionConfig
members.doc: RSVP collection configuration. Can be used to set limits.

members.name: about
members.doc: Rich-text content for About Event section (HTML).

members.name: language
members.doc:
Content language code in ISO 639-1 format.
 Used for translating ticket PDF labels, registration form, automatic emails, etc.
 Supported languages: ar, bg, cs, da, de, el, en, es, fi, fr, he, hi, hu, id, it, ja, ko, ms, nl, no, pl, pt, ro, ru, sv, th, tl, tr, uk, zh.
 Defaults to en.

members.name: draft
members.doc: Whether event should be created as draft. Draft events are hidden from site visitors.

members.name: draft
members.doc:
If true, event will be copied as draft.
 Otherwise copied event will be published, unless it is draft.

members.name: fields
members.doc:
Set of field paths to update.
 <!--ONLY:REST-->
 Fields will be auto-populated from the `event` entity unless added to the request explicitly.
 <!--END:ONLY:REST-->
 Behavior follows [google.protobuf.FieldMask](https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/reference/google.protobuf#google.protobuf.FieldMask) semantics.

members.name: draft
members.doc:
If true, event will be copied as draft.
 Otherwise copied event will be published, unless it is draft.

members.name: fields
members.doc:
Set of field paths to update.
 <!--ONLY:REST-->
 Fields will be auto-populated from the `event` entity unless added to the request explicitly.
 <!--END:ONLY:REST-->
 Behavior follows [google.protobuf.FieldMask](https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/reference/google.protobuf#google.protobuf.FieldMask) semantics.

members.name: language
members.doc:
Content language code in ISO 639-1 format.
 Used for translating ticket PDF labels, registration form, automatic emails, etc.
 Supported languages: ar, bg, cs, da, de, el, en, es, fi, fr, he, hi, hu, id, it, ja, ko, ms, nl, no, pl, pt, ro, ru, sv, th, tl, tr, uk, zh.
 Defaults to en.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: ID of category to be deleted.

members.name: query
members.doc: Query options. See [API Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language) for more details.

members.name: fieldset
members.doc:
Predefined sets of fields to return.
- `COUNTS`: Returns `assignedEventsCount`.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: ID of category to which events should be assigned.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: A list of category ids to which events should be assigned.

members.name: beforeEventId
members.doc: Move the Category Event ID before this Event ID

members.name: afterEventId
members.doc: Move the Category Event ID after this Event ID

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event canceled timestamp in ISO UTC format.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. Map of copied ticket definitions from original event.
 Key represents ticket def id in the original event.
 Value represents ticket def id in the newly created event.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event created timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: derivedFromInstanceId
members.doc: Instance ID. Indicates the original app instance which current event was derived from.

members.name: derivedFromEventId
members.doc: Event ID. Indicates the original event which current event was derived from.

members.name: ticketDefinitions
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. Map of copied ticket definitions from original event.
 Key represents ticket def id in the original event.
 Value represents ticket def id in the newly created event.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event created timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: derivedFromInstanceId
members.doc: Instance ID. Indicates the original app instance which current event was derived from.

members.name: derivedFromEventId
members.doc: Event ID. Indicates the original event which current event was derived from.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event deleted timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event end timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event publish timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: derivedFromEventId
members.doc:
Event ID. Indicates the original event which current event was derived from.
 Can be used to track the original event and add missing information.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Reminder timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: startsIn
members.doc: Time until the event starts (currently, reminder is triggered 1 day before event starts).

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event start timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event update timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: labels
members.doc: Name control labels of each input

members.name: labels
members.doc: Address control labels for each input.

members.name: full
members.doc: Whether address is multi-line (consisting of multiple fields such as country, city, postal code). When false, address is single-line.

members.name: single
members.doc: Input label for a single guest.

members.name: labels
members.doc: Additional guests control labels for each input.

members.name: namesMandatory
members.doc: Whether individual guest names are required.

members.name: options
members.doc: Predefined options guests can choose from.

members.name: options
members.doc: Predefined options guests can choose from.

members.name: mandatory
members.doc: Whether at least one checkbox is required.

members.name: options
members.doc: Predefined options guests can choose from.

members.name: multiLine
members.doc: Whether input control should allow multiple lines in text.

members.name: comment
members.doc: Whether input control should be displayed as a comment.

members.name: form
members.doc:
Currently published event form.
 Published form is visible to site visitors.

members.name: draftForm
members.doc:
Draft event form.
 Not available to visitors unless published.

members.name: address
members.doc: Single-line or full address input control.

members.name: date
members.doc: Day, month, year date input control.

members.name: radioButton
members.doc: Single-choice radio button style input control.

members.name: orderIndex
members.doc: Index used to sort input controls in ascending order.

members.name: address
members.doc: Single-line or full address input control.

members.name: date
members.doc: Day, month, year date input control.

members.name: fields
members.doc:
Set of field paths, specifying which parts of this resource to update.
 When fields are empty, request is interpreted as full update.
 Behavior follows [google.protobuf.FieldMask](https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/reference/google.protobuf#google.protobuf.FieldMask) semantics.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • INCLUDED - Tax is included in the ticket price
  • ADDED - Tax is added to the order at the checkout
  • ADDED_AT_CHECKOUT - Tax is added to the final total at the checkout

Possible values are:
  • MANUAL - Created manually by the user.
  • AUTO - Created automatically.
  • RECURRING_EVENT - Created when publishing recurring events.
  • HIDDEN - Category is hidden.
  • COMPONENT - Category is used to store component events.

Possible values are:
  • INPUT - Single text value field.
  • TEXTAREA - Single text value field.
  • DROPDOWN - Single-choice field of predefined values.
  • RADIO - Single-choice field of predefined values.
  • CHECKBOX - Multiple-choice field of predefined values.
  • NAME - First and last name fields.
  • GUEST_CONTROL - Additional guests and respective guest names fields.
  • ADDRESS_SHORT - Single-line address field.
  • ADDRESS_FULL - Full address field.
  • DATE - Year, month and day fields.

Possible values are:
  • TEXT
  • NUMBER
  • TEXT_ARRAY
  • DATE_TIME
  • ADDRESS

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_SUBDIVISION_TYPE
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_1 - State
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_2 - County
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_3 - City/town
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_4 - Neighborhood/quarter
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_5 - Street/block
  • COUNTRY - ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_0. Indicates the national political entity, and is typically the highest order type returned by the Geocoder.

Possible values are:
  • SCHEDULED - Event is public and scheduled to start
  • STARTED - Event has started
  • ENDED - Event has ended
  • CANCELED - Event was canceled
  • DRAFT - Event is not public and needs to be published

Possible values are:
  • NA_EVENT_TYPE - Type not available for this request fieldset
  • RSVP - Registration via RSVP
  • TICKETS - Registration via ticket purchase
  • EXTERNAL - External registration
  • NO_REGISTRATION - Registration not available

Possible values are:
  • NA_REGISTRATION_STATUS - Registration status is not applicable
  • CLOSED - Registration to event is closed
  • CLOSED_MANUALLY - Registration to event is closed manually
  • OPEN_RSVP - Registration is open via RSVP
  • OPEN_RSVP_WAITLIST - Registration to event waitlist is open via RSVP
  • OPEN_TICKETS - Registration is open via ticket purchase
  • OPEN_EXTERNAL - Registration is open via external URL
  • SCHEDULED_RSVP - Registration will be open via RSVP

Possible values are:
  • VISITOR - Site visitor (including member)
  • MEMBER - Site member
  • VISITOR_OR_MEMBER - Site visitor or member

Possible values are:
  • MEETING - Everyone in the meeting can publish and subscribe video and audio.
  • WEBINAR - Guests can only subscribe to video and audio.

Possible values are:
  • VENUE
  • ONLINE

Possible values are:
  • ONE_TIME - Event occurs only once.
  • RECURRING - Event is recurring.
  • RECURRING_NEXT - Marks the next upcoming occurrence of the recurring event.
  • RECURRING_LAST_ENDED - Marks the most recent ended occurrence of the recurring event.
  • RECURRING_LAST_CANCELED - Marks the most recent canceled occurrence of the recurring event.

Possible values are:
  • YES_ONLY - Only YES RSVP status is available for RSVP registration
  • YES_AND_NO - YES and NO RSVP status options are available for the registration

Possible values are:
  • FULL
  • DETAILS - Include `description`, `mainImage` and `calendarLinks` in the response.
  • TEXTS - Include `about` event rich text in the response.
  • REGISTRATION - Include `registration` in the response.
  • URLS - Include `eventPageUrl` in the response.
  • FORM - Include `form` in the response.
  • DASHBOARD - Include `dashboard` in the response.
  • FEED - Include `feed` in the response.
  • ONLINE_CONFERENCING_SESSION - Include `onlineConferencing` in the response.
  • SEO_SETTINGS - Include `seoSettings` in the response.
  • AGENDA - Include `agendaSettings` in the response.
  • CATEGORIES - Include `categories` in the response.
  • CUSTOMIZABLE_TICKETS

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC

Possible values are:
  • ATTENDING - User is attending the event. User has RSVP with status YES or has ordered tickets.

Possible values are:
  • COUNTS - Include `assignedEventsCount` in the response.
